Reviews.Title: “OK for a single night close to Central Station / Airport”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTravels2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok value for a cheap night / layover close to City / Airport / Train. Don't expect luxury or great service, but rooms are adequate and reasonably clean. For convenience and price (and 1 night only) this works well. I stayed as I was attending a function close by and was only in town for a night. Central rooms, whilst a little claustrophobic (no windows) are probably better for street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character in teh heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: islandyuppie
Reviews.Content: I found this place very interesting - a mix of the old and new. Its rooms are charming and well appointed - gives you that sense of travel back in time feeling. Depending on which floor you are on, it may be quiet or loud as the hotel has bars, restaurants and is known for brewing its own beer. Live bands play there as well. Its location was pretty central - walking distance to a lot of Sydney's attractions and CBD and accessible to most of the stuff you want to see and do in Sydney. The only downside is that thi splace has no elevators. If you are travelling with heavy luggage which we wer, it's a challenge taking this up and down your room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Aroudthewoooorld
Reviews.Content: Due to a flight delay, we arrived a day later. We duly informed the hotel by email, the day before, but they said the reception closes at 18.30, and my email arrived 30 minites later... Actually, the reception is a hole in a wall, and on the other side there was a rude woman that, when you ask for the manager, says: "the manager is me!, You won't talk to anyone else!" The hole in the wall and the room are at the third floor (at the floow below, a thai restaurant). Elevator not always available. To reach the room, I had to move an ironing board, that was in the middle of the corridor. Tired after a long flight, I jumped on the bed and crashed in the wall: the bed was on wheels! No view, just some light from a horrible window. Orrible bath, you wouldn't touch anything. Taps dripping, mouldy shower courtain, basic furniture, that was new when my grandma got married. My girlfriend and me tried to console ourselves: after a sleep, we said, things will be better. But that night, it was karaoke time at the thai restaurant! (I've been told is not an uncommon event, there). And so, thay and chinese traditional songs had sung till late night. Would I recommend this place to a friend? I wouldn't be bad enough to recomment it to an enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming heritage boutique hotel for reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: stephanie60
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double for 4 days on a recent visit to Sydney. The room was very small and fronted a busy street. The reception clerk upgraded us to a deluxe triple at a lower rate that was very nice and spacious with a fireplace, crown moulding and a tin ceiling. We were in the refurbished area with carpets so did not hear noise made on wooden floors, but the music in the bar did last until about midnight although I did not find it to be a problem. Reception is open until 6pm on weeknights and 9pm on weekends so if there is a problem after this time it can be difficult. We did not find this hotel to be centrally located but it was only a couple of blocks from the Museum station and close to Central station and we took the train to everything in just a matter of minutes with a week long red line rail pass (not the Explorer bus) that allowed us to travel on the train, bus and ferry. If you prefer modern and streamlined this is not the hotel for you. This is a comfortable, bit shabby boutique heritage hotel which we found to be just right for us as we tend to avoid the high rise commercial hotels in favor of much smaller boutique types.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: BeerBaron
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent trip to Sydney to watch the rugby, had I the ability to predict the outcome of the game I would have stayed in Melbourne. The staff I encountered were very freindly and helpfull and whilst I did not eat there, I noticed upon my arrival that the restuarant and bar downstairs were full which is a good indication I guess. The room itself was very small however the bed was very comfortable and my room was not situated on the outer sides of the building. This provided a quiet nights sleep with no street noise however there was absolutely no view to speak, something that I hardly regard as important. The price was just under $80 a night and due to the fact it was over the weekend and that the hotels location is central and within walking distance to many points of interest, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not fussed by basic but clean amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: DavidKarlsson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its excellent location, just off Hyde Park and a great start to explore both the north parts of the CBD and the Surry Hills and Darlinghurst areas. The room itself is small but acceptable as long as you're not staying too long. Its location above a bar isn't the best on a weekend as it was quite loud until late. And true to form, the ultrasensitive smoke alarm went off at 1:00 am. It's a decent price for the location, but don't stay if you're sensitive to noise, especially on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: scottiers7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on a course, the room was clean, comfortable bed, excellent bathroom, aircon and t&c facilities. the room was really small, but fine for just me. I loved the live entertainment every night and Alice's Thia upstairs. It was noisy outside -sirens etc but not noisy in the hotel. $70pn inc a breakky you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed!”
Reviews.Author: pitviper
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE!! Worst place to stay in Australia! Not only are the rooms nasty, and infested with cockaroaches, but we were robbed, by someone who has a key to the rooms. After a day in the city we come back to our room ripped apart our luggage all over the place and all our money and valubles gone!! We lost about $6000.00 Dollars. We filed a police report and after they were done investigating the hotel managment were very rude and in a hurry to get rid of us. I strongly suspect the manager Amanda J for being responsible. So tell everyone you know not to stay here, It's best for a crooked business like this to go down!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Very disappointed. Don't be cheated.”
Reviews.Author: boyloon
Reviews.Content: Hi all, Let me share my experience living in this so-called "boutique" hotel. The furniture and decorations in this hotel look good. But, very unfortunately, we lived in a room which was located directly above the function room on level 3. There were music bands in the function room and making noise to the entire building. I can tell you that they played until mid-night. Unless you will come back to the hotel after 12am, otherwise you won't be able to sleep because of the noise by the music bands. Even though some other suites are not above the function room, i am sure that the noise was still extremely terrible. In the next morning, fault fire alarm woke me up when i was lack of rest due to the noise in the night before. The alarm kept ringing for another 30 minutes. WTF! Beside, the location is not as good as we thought. There was a long distance to all the attractions. Thus, this hotel is horrible. Stay away from this. Chris Perth

Reviews.Title: “Cheap....but not cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: royalsfan1
Reviews.Content: Well, what to say about this hotel... On a positive note, its cheap, good central location and staff were friendly, what you'd expect. Now the negatives. We viewed this hotel on the internet and thought it looked nice so we booked. We arrived on a bank holiday and found the place all locked up with nobody in sight, we actually thought the place had closed down! Reception not obvious at all. When we actually got in, our room we were given was more like a cupboard....no windows, dark, shabby ceiling and incredibly inhospitable. We asked for a room change and were duly given one. The pictures DO NOT resemble the hotel in our view. The new room was satisfactory, with the exception of cockroaches which visited us in the night. We were on first floor, so had to use the stairwell to from the premises and found further dead cockroaches here. In summary, if you are on a budget, we'd recommend the place, if not splash the cash and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: buns123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week last year and paid a very reasonable price - about $70 per night from memory, via a last minute rates site. Great value! The room was clean, quite spacious, with a TV, kettle, and mini fridge. The bathroom was lovely - very new, tiled, clean. Towels got changed daily, and were fluffy, white, and huge! While the inlcuded breakfast was simple - toast, cereal, fruit, coffee - the coffee was *real* coffee. Having a latte every morning was a real treat! Management were very friendly, and helped me in arranging transfers. Watch out if you have a lot of bags though - sometimes it's hard to snag the elevator. Great value, great location - Oxford St is around the corner, the CBD is literally up the road! I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “scruffy dump, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: steveblower
Reviews.Content: What is good............ the continental breakfast included, and for 5 AUD you can upgrade to a monster full cooked job. It is cheap. it has a good coffee shop on site. it is in a very useful location. What is not so good. where to start.................... At 1800, I called them to make sure that the reception / bottle shop would still be open when I arrived at 2230. Oh yes, no problems mate, we will be here. Well, they were not. I bashed the windows and doors until the bar manager came out and rescued me. She explained that as they were not busy, they had decided to close early. My room, where I am writing this now, is small, scruffy, cold with broken furniture. I dont think the refurb has reached the top floor yet! Certainly, the pictures on the hotels website do not match my reality now. The route from the street entrance to my toom is via the most untidy, dirty staircase that just gets more depressing as you go up it. No way would I stay here again, never mind the price.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Honey510
Reviews.Content: I stayed here September 2004, so things might have changed since I visited. I thought the location was great - we walked everywhere. The room itself was quite small but neverless it was clean and tidy and with so much to do in Syndey, you won't be spending much time in your room anyway. Didn't experience any problems with the staff. The receptionist was helpful and courteous and happily answered all our "touristy" questions. The breakfast downstairs was very nice too, and set me up for a day exploring. You can't really complain for the price. Hotel aside, my highlights must be... Syndey Harbour Bridge climb Meat and Wine Company Restaurant in Darling Harbour Aquarium (early evening when you have the place to yourselves more or less). Shopping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Come on, it's OK!”
Reviews.Author: veekz
Reviews.Content: Listen, this hotel is in a great location, the old building is fabulous, and you can pop downstairs for the sizeable continental breakfast which is included in the price. The rooms are a bit shabby, but who cares? If you want something nice in the CBD, you're gunna have to pay more. I loved my stay at the Macquarie, and would definitely go back. I recommend the corner room on the third (?) floor, with the shower right in front of the corner window. It has a little table and a couple of soft chairs as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru internet. It looked like a great place from the photos showed on the web, but it turned out to be a total mistake to book this hotel. Arrived at 10 am on Sat, the entry door was not open despite they state reception hour from 8:30 on Sat. Struggled for about 1 hour, finally one of the guests who stayed the hotel opened the door for us. Then another mission was to find a receptionist, spent another 1/2 hour on searching the recepionist. Okay, so far so good, we thought that was enough pain, the room should be okay. That was a total shock when we got checked in and unlocked the room we were going to live. A small shabby room, dirty bath room, you name it... The worst of the worst, there's a big big party downstairs from the evening to about 2am, we couldn't sleep at all due to the noise level. We initially booked 4 nights thru the web, but couldn't stand any more, checked out after 2 horrible nights. Luckily we found another hotel with the same price ($99), that was far far better. Anyway, if you want to get depressed, go to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Macquarie Boutique Hotel before we read any of the reviews on trip advisor. After we read them, i wanted to cancel our stay there but my husband assured me that it would be ok. And it was...ok. The service was, at best, acceptable. The rooms were not very clean and the walls were extremely thin. However, we did not complain as we only paid $89 per night inc breakfast and so we couldn't expect luxury. If you are looking for somewhere nice, dont stay here. If you are looking for somewhere cheap, fairly central and are not too fussy about your surroundings, it should be ok!

Reviews.Title: “Mouse on my Bed”
Reviews.Author: reviewbysteve
Reviews.Content: Dirty, No Curtains and Mouse Ridden!! Unfortunately, I stayed there over Christmas. Considering that I'd paid $110 per night to stay there I found the hotel was dirty and a rip off. My small room had NO Curtains which made it difficult to sleep, and while I was watching TV a Mouse crawled on my bed. I left immediately and stayed in the Travel Lodge across the road which was 100% better. I wish I'd read the reviews on Trip Advisor before I stayed there, instead of looking at the Macquarie Hotel website, as the photographs and descriptions are deceptive. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget stay. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like in the game "Monopoly", this "hotel" seems to have been built from a collection of "green houses," that is, the owners keep parlaying their profits and improving the property sideways and upward. This collection makes for an interesting floor plan. The ground (1st) floor is a friendly corner pub and literally outside and next door is the breakfast room (try the Vegemite on toast for a laugh) and behind that is the slot machines game room. On the 2nd floor is the billiard room and Thai restaurant, where the food is quite good and reasonably priced. On the 3rd floor is the reception desk and the rooms are on the 3rd and 4th floor. An elevator, which is badly needed for hauling your luggage upstairs, was being installed while we were there in early November 2004. Upon arrival, we had a hard time locating the reception desk and once we found it, we noticed that it was not staffed at times during our stay. When they are there, the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are tiny but comfortable, clean and safe. The ensuite bathroom/shower is claustrophobic but clean and well serviced, and beware, the water temperature fluctuates radically sometimes. The wood floor creaks and the walls are thin so if that bothers you bring some ear plugs. The air conditioner, tv, small refrigerator and hot water kettle are nice amenities in the room. There are 2 Internet access stations available on the 3rd floor for a fee. Wi-fi and ethernet are also available in the rooms. The location is great for the price: in a safe neighborhood and relatively quiet street for a downtown area, just a block from Hyde Park, close to Central station, not far from Darling Harbor and close to good inexpensive food in Chinatown. The Sydney Opera House is a manageable walk away with many places to explore in between, good for a day trip. If you are an adventurous/tolerant budget traveler looking for a unique, affordable and comfortable place to hang your hat at the end of a long day touring the city, this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “horrible! don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the upside: reasonable price (100,-), reasonably good location if you know your ways. The best about the hotel is the breakfast at the cafe downstairs. Best: have breakfast there, sleep somewhere else. On the low side: this hotel is a ---------. bathroom mouldy and bad, bad smell, we showered in our thongs, best not shower at all! hotel located on a busy street crossing, you're better off sleeping right on the pavement, really! the bed moves like it's on wheels, the bed sheets are dirty, the furniture used to be nice 100 years ago, now all broken, blinds broken, hotel is on 3rd floor but no elevator, fridge from the 18th century and noisy, must be shut down at night. please, do yourself a favour and for an extra 20 bucks get a room at Hotel Ibis just down't the road, at least it's sound proof and clean!

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i arrived in sydney mid-morning november 2003 and had booked this hotel from their website - the photos made it look a reasonable budget accommodation in sydney.. i had quite a lot of luggage and there was NO WAY i would ever have got it up the two flights of stairs with no elevator - the 'hotel' is a traditional aussie pub that seems to have its business primarily from horse race betting and entrance to the hotel is through this rather salubrious area.. i left my luggage downstairs in the pub to see if i could get some help but was told not - and seeing the state of the rooms upstairs when i found someone to talk to, i was quite relieved - it was a fleapit - so i went and collected my luggae and set off on foot to find somewhere fit to stay - not the perfect scenario after a long flight from the states... i know budget is budget - but there are much better places around sydney to stay if $$ are tight than this place. I wouldnt recommend this place to a dog...

HotelInfo.Name: Macquarie Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 42 Wentworth Avenue, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
